name: Quanero VR
description: Quanero is an experimental VR experience for the HTC Vive and the Oculus Rift. Your goal is to figure out what caused a violent incident in a futuristic bar by manipulating the time. You can slow down time, reverse it or bring it to a halt. Explore the scene, unlock the story's branch points and unravel the mystery.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7, 8, 8.1, 10 Processor: I7 3770 Memory: 8 GB RAM Graphics: GeForce GTX 970 DirectX: Version 11 Storage: 3270 MB available space
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 7, 8, 8.1, 10 Processor: I7 3770 Memory: 8 GB RAM Graphics: GeForce GTX 980 DirectX: Version 11 Storage: 3270 MB available space

reviews.review_text: While the voice acting and animations need work, the concept of this is fantastic. It was fun putting the pieces together to see what happened actually happened. You think you figured it out until you look closer. It would be great to see something like this turn into a full game one day.

I know-> So Cheesy but -> This IS the killer app for VR ...   This team is simply amazing and full disclosure ... I don't know them or their company before playing this tonight and I say this completly on my own accord...   If you are into movies: this is cool. if you are into sluething: this is cool.. if you are into Rube Goldberg Machines: this is cool... if you are into 4 8 15 16 23 42 ... this is cool .... If you are into Drama; this is cool..... if you love Story telling: this is the future! ......  Liking just one of these things individually makes this experience Amazingly Entertaining!

OK, this concept is great. The devs are clearly onto something here and I would gladly pay for a full game based on this mechanic. Totally worth downloading and seeing for yourself. Hope to see more of this!
Haven't seen anything quite like this, very nice! If you're looking for a gripping narrative that invites you to explore on your own terms, step right in!

Excellent!!! Very well done and I love the concept. I felt like a detective... a very powerful time altering detective! The game was slightly blurry. No graphical settings but I imagine it will come later. Very Nice concept and I hope it turns into a full game. I will buy it for sure!!!

Very fun and found myself wanting more. ...If you are like me, you first drop into this experience not sure what the point is. However, as you push play, rewind, and explore what's going on, you find there is some depth to a story being told. The fun is putting it all together. Like a detective, there is joy in weeding through the distractors and finding out what really went wrong. Great time and would love to do more of this.
Very fun concept. I'd love to see this becoming a full game.

Was extermely interesting working through all the details to figure out what happend and how all the events are connected. Would have liked some way to 'complete' the game by supplying my observations/answer but was fun regardless.

An enjoyable, short experience/game with some issues. Mainly the visuals are quite blurry when compared with other software. However the crime solving, time manipulation gimmick more than makes up for the short comings and I can't really complain for free.

A fun little game. You get to watch some crazy events go down with the power to stop and rewind time. See the story from different points of view as you watch the characters. 6 different stories take place all in this small dinner.  It would be cool to see a crime scene investagator type game like this.
A great but short interactive experience. Very high quality production levels and professionally put together, well worth trying out.
Excellent concept and very fun to play! Can't wait for the content to get expanded. You really feel like a detective and its fun to see the action from every angle.

This was an intense experience. Much better than I expected. It took me a while to figure out that it's not really a game, but 'just' a story where you can mess with time. This did not dissapoint me, because at that point I was already completely caught up in the story.  The graphics are extremely well done, so you do actually feel like you are at some future alien bar. The good graphics and the possibility to rewind and stop time adds some weird element of voyeurism in Quanero. This is what makes the whole thing extremely great. It takes a while to feel comfortable breaking the NPCs 'personal space', listening in on their personal conversations, Look at them when time i frozen, etc.   After you do get comfortable with this, you really start playing around with time, almost abusing this new godlike power.  This concept could be a completely new type of game. There are definitely posibilities here. I can't wait for more of this kind.
Fantastic concept. Good graphics. Deep short experience brimming with subtlety. The UI leaves a bit to be desired, but once you get the hang of things it's fine.
Short but quite a bit of fun!  It's interesting to rewatch the scene unfolding and realize the source behind each surprise.
Very Cool way to experience VR

Very cool idea. A short experience lacking polish (not very good acting, script is not great, character movement is quite akward at times) but reccomended as a free experience. This type of storytelling/investigation has great potential in future VR games.

Its a really cool idea for a game, But rewinding time is really slow and finding out what happened wont take you more than a couple mins. I wish that it was a tad longer, the crime was a little more subtle and required a little more detective work. One thing that is amazing though is the setting menu. Adjusting you quality was easier in this game than any I have played on the vive.
